medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 41-year-old male, experienced relapsing symptoms over an 11-year period despite appropriate antifungal therapy. There were ongoing relapses documented microbiologically, necessitating alterations in antifungal treatment. Symptoms had persisted with multiple relapses requiring various antifungal agents to achieve CSF sterilization.
medical_history.past_medical_history: CARD9 deficiency marked by susceptibility to candidiasis; previously documented relapses of meningoencephalitis during antifungal treatment.
medical_history.family_history: A great uncle died of a brain tumor in his 30s; however, no genetic sequencing was performed for familial conditions.
